clusters.title: Netanyahu hopes for hostage release in 'coming days' as bombs continue to strike Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: Negotiations for Hostage Release in Gaza Reported

items.title: Netanyahu hopes for hostage release in 'coming days' as bombs continue to strike Gaza
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared Israel and Hamas are on the brink of a hostage deal as President Donald Trump’s son-in-law and his Middle East envoy both traveled to the region for talks, raising hopes Sunday that the war in Gaza was on the verge of ending
items.content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared Israel and Hamas are on the brink of a hostage deal as President Donald Trump’s son-in-law and his Middle East envoy both traveled to the region for talks, raising hopes Sunday that the war in Gaza was on the verge of ending

items.title: Negotiations due in Cairo, Trump says Israel agrees to a 'withdrawal line'
items.standfirst: Negotiators were converging on Cairo on Sunday (October 5) ahead of talks aimed at ending nearly two years of war in Gaza. The diplomatic moves came after the Palestinian militant group Hamas responded positively to US President Donald Trump's roadmap for freeing the captives. Trump said on Truth Social that Israel had agreed to an initial line of withdrawal in Gaza and that this had been shared with Hamas. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky tells us more.
items.content: Negotiators were converging on Cairo on Sunday (October 5) ahead of talks aimed at ending nearly two years of war in Gaza. The diplomatic moves came after the Palestinian militant group Hamas responded positively to US President Donald Trump's roadmap for freeing the captives. Trump said on Truth Social that Israel had agreed to an initial line of withdrawal in Gaza and that this had been shared with Hamas. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky tells us more.

items.title: 10/4: CBS Weekend News
items.standfirst: Netanyahu signals that Gaza peace deal could be close; A look at the booming business of Taylor Swift and her brand.

items.title: Gaza live: Negotiators due in Cairo, Trump says Israel agrees to a 'withdrawal line'
items.standfirst: Israeli and Hamas negotiatiors converge on Cairo on Sunday for talks aimed at ending nearly two years of war in Gaza, with Israel's leader expressing hope that the hostages still being held in the devastated enclave could be released within days. US President Donald Trump said in a social media post on Saturday that Israel has agreed to an "initial withdrawal line" for Gaza, adding that "when Hamas confirms", a ceasefire will be effective "immediately". Follow our liveblog for updates.
items.content: Israeli and Hamas negotiatiors converge on Cairo on Sunday for talks aimed at ending nearly two years of war in Gaza, with Israel's leader expressing hope that the hostages still being held in the devastated enclave could be released within days. US President Donald Trump said in a social media post on Saturday that Israel has agreed to an "initial withdrawal line" for Gaza, adding that "when Hamas confirms", a ceasefire will be effective "immediately". Follow our liveblog for updates.

items.title: LIVE: Israel targets Gaza’s ‘safe zones’ as Egypt to host negotiations
items.standfirst: Talks aim at ending nearly two years of war, with Israel's leader expressing hope that captives would be released.
items.content: Talks aim at ending nearly two years of war, with Israel's leader expressing hope that captives would be released.

items.title: US envoys head to Egypt for Gaza ceasefire talks as Trump says ‘we are very close’ to deal
items.standfirst: US president says he will push to finalize agreement in the coming days even as scores of Palestinians killed in latest Israeli attacksDonald Trump’s son-in-law and a senior envoy are heading to Egypt to begin ceasefire negotiations, the White House has said, as the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, said he hoped to bring all remaining hostages home in the coming days.A White House official said the US president was sending his envoys, Jared Kushner and Steve Witkoff, to Egypt on Saturday to finalise the technical details of a hostage release and discuss a lasting ceasefire deal a day after Hamas said it was ready to free hostages under Trump’s plan to end the two-year-old war. In an interview, Trump said “we are very close” to reaching an agreement. Continue reading...
items.content: US president says he will push to finalize agreement in the coming days even as scores of Palestinians killed in latest Israeli attacksDonald Trump’s son-in-law and a senior envoy are heading to Egypt to begin ceasefire negotiations, the White House has said, as the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, said he hoped to bring all remaining hostages home in the coming days.A White House official said the US president was sending his envoys, Jared Kushner and Steve Witkoff, to Egypt on Saturday to finalise the technical details of a hostage release and discuss a lasting ceasefire deal a day after Hamas said it was ready to free hostages under Trump’s plan to end the two-year-old war. In an interview, Trump said “we are very close” to reaching an agreement. Continue reading...

items.title: Netanyahu hopes to announce release of Gaza hostages "in the coming days"
items.standfirst: The plan called for Hamas to return all Israeli hostages and for the Israeli military to begin withdrawing from parts of the Gaza Strip in phases.
items.content: The plan called for Hamas to return all Israeli hostages and for the Israeli military to begin withdrawing from parts of the Gaza Strip in phases.

items.title: A look at the booming business of Taylor Swift and her brand
items.standfirst: Taylor Swift's new album "The Life of a Showgirl" is big business. It's also breaking her own records, including several on Spotify. Ali Bauman shows how Swift is also queen of the box office this weekend.
items.content: Taylor Swift's new album "The Life of a Showgirl" is big business. It's also breaking her own records, including several on Spotify. Ali Bauman shows how Swift is also queen of the box office this weekend.

items.title: Netanyahu signals that Gaza peace deal could be close
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he hoped to announce the release of all the hostages being held by Hamas in Gaza in one fell swoop in the coming days. Debora Patta reports on the latest from the Middle East.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he hoped to announce the release of all the hostages being held by Hamas in Gaza in one fell swoop in the coming days. Debora Patta reports on the latest from the Middle East.

items.title: Netanyahu says he hopes to announce hostage release in the 'coming days'
items.standfirst: Hamas will disarm "the easy way or the hard way", Israel's PM says after the group gave its response to a peace plan.
items.content: Hamas will disarm "the easy way or the hard way", Israel's PM says after the group gave its response to a peace plan.

items.title: Trump urges Hamas to 'move quickly' on Gaza peace plan
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday that he hopes Hamas will have returned all remaining hostages by Oct. 13.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday that he hopes Hamas will have returned all remaining hostages by Oct. 13.(Image credit: Eyad Baba)

items.title: US-backed peace plan for Gaza: What to expect from further negotiations?
items.standfirst: Israel's army said Saturday (October 4) that it would advance preparations for the first phase of Donald Trump's plan to end the war in Gaza. Two envoys of US President Donald Trump headed to Egypt on Saturday to discuss the release of hostages in Gaza, while Israeli forces launched deadly strikes across the territory. For more analysis on US-backed plan, FRANCE 24's Catherine Viette is joined by Hussein Ibish, senior resident scholar at the Arab Gulf States Insitute in Washington.
items.content: Israel's army said Saturday (October 4) that it would advance preparations for the first phase of Donald Trump's plan to end the war in Gaza. Two envoys of US President Donald Trump headed to Egypt on Saturday to discuss the release of hostages in Gaza, while Israeli forces launched deadly strikes across the territory. For more analysis on US-backed plan, FRANCE 24's Catherine Viette is joined by Hussein Ibish, senior resident scholar at the Arab Gulf States Insitute in Washington.

items.title: Israel says it prepares for first phase of Trump plan after striking Gaza overnight
items.standfirst: Israel’s army said it would advance preparations for the first phase of US President Donald Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza and return all the remaining hostages. The news came after Israel launched dozens of air strikes and artillery attacks on Gaza City overnight, Gaza’s civil defence agency said.
items.content: Israel’s army said it would advance preparations for the first phase of US President Donald Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza and return all the remaining hostages. The news came after Israel launched dozens of air strikes and artillery attacks on Gaza City overnight, Gaza’s civil defence agency said.

items.title: Trump's peace plan: Residents in Gaza and in Israel react to Hamas's response
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner and a senior US envoy are heading to Egypt Saturday (October 4) to finalize hostage release details, a White House official said after Hamas reacted positively to a peace plan to end two years of war.
items.content: President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner and a senior US envoy are heading to Egypt Saturday (October 4) to finalize hostage release details, a White House official said after Hamas reacted positively to a peace plan to end two years of war.

items.title: Israel orders military to halt Gaza City campaign but continues strikes on the territory
items.standfirst: IDF says it was directed to ready for first part of Donald Trump’s plan to end war in Gaza after Hamas agrees to release hostagesThe Israeli military has been ordered to halt its campaign in Gaza City by its political leadership, Israeli army radio reported on Saturday, while it was preparing for the first phase of Donald Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza and release all hostages.In a statement, the Israeli military said it was directed to “advance readiness” for the first part of the Trump plan. Army radio reported that operations in Gaza would be reduced to “the minimum” with troops meant only to carry out defensive strikes. Continue reading...
items.content: IDF says it was directed to ready for first part of Donald Trump’s plan to end war in Gaza after Hamas agrees to release hostagesThe Israeli military has been ordered to halt its campaign in Gaza City by its political leadership, Israeli army radio reported on Saturday, while it was preparing for the first phase of Donald Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza and release all hostages.In a statement, the Israeli military said it was directed to “advance readiness” for the first part of the Trump plan. Army radio reported that operations in Gaza would be reduced to “the minimum” with troops meant only to carry out defensive strikes. Continue reading...

items.title: Can the US-backed peace 'sketch' for Gaza succeed?
items.standfirst: Israel's army said Saturday (October 4) that it would advance preparations for the first phase of US President Donald Trump's plan to end the war in Gaza. US President called to halt bombardments following Hamas's acceptance of some elements of his plan. But Israel launched air strikes on Gaza City overnight, Gaza’s civil defence agency said. For more analysis on that plan, William Hilderbrandt is joined by Scott Lucas, professor of International Politics at University College Dublin Clinton Institute.
items.content: Israel's army said Saturday (October 4) that it would advance preparations for the first phase of US President Donald Trump's plan to end the war in Gaza. US President called to halt bombardments following Hamas's acceptance of some elements of his plan. But Israel launched air strikes on Gaza City overnight, Gaza’s civil defence agency said. For more analysis on that plan, William Hilderbrandt is joined by Scott Lucas, professor of International Politics at University College Dublin Clinton Institute.

items.title: Hamas agrees to release all Israeli hostages, conditions pending
items.standfirst: Hamas said it has agreed to release all Israeli hostages, alive or dead, as long as “the field conditions for the exchange are met” and expressed willingness to negotiate through mediators on President Donald Trump’s plan for peace in the Middle East
items.content: Hamas said it has agreed to release all Israeli hostages, alive or dead, as long as “the field conditions for the exchange are met” and expressed willingness to negotiate through mediators on President Donald Trump’s plan for peace in the Middle East

Negotiations are underway in Cairo, with Trump's envoy present for talks.
Trump stated Israel agreed to an initial withdrawal line in Gaza.

Bombs continue to strike Gaza as talks progress.

clusters.title: Trump deploys National Guard to Chicago as judge blocks plan to send troops to Portland
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Deploys National Guard to Chicago, Judge Blocks Portland Plan

items.title: Trump deploys National Guard to Chicago as judge blocks plan to send troops to Portland
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump authorised deployment of 300 national guardsmen to Chicago after a federal agent shot an allegedly armed motorist there on Saturday, while a judge blocked the attempt to send the military into Portland, another Democratic-run city. Chicago and Portland are the latest flashpoints in the Trump administration's rollout of raids, following the deployment of troops to Los Angeles and Washington.
items.content: US President Donald Trump authorised deployment of 300 national guardsmen to Chicago after a federal agent shot an allegedly armed motorist there on Saturday, while a judge blocked the attempt to send the military into Portland, another Democratic-run city. Chicago and Portland are the latest flashpoints in the Trump administration's rollout of raids, following the deployment of troops to Los Angeles and Washington.

items.title: Federal Judge Temporarily Blocks Trump's Deployment Of National Guard Troops To Portland
items.standfirst: U.S. District Judge Karin Immergut on Saturday put a temporary halt on President Donald Trump's plan to send 200 National Guard troops to Portland, while a lawsuit over the decision is still being decided. Restraining Order During Lawsuit Oregon's Democratic Attorney General Dan Rayfield filed the…

Restraining Order During Lawsuit Oregon's Democratic Attorney General Dan Rayfield filed the…

items.title: Trump authorises deployment of 300 National Guard troops to Chicago
items.standfirst: The controversial move follows protests over ramped-up immigration enforcement and the shooting of a woman during unrest on Saturday.
items.content: The controversial move follows protests over ramped-up immigration enforcement and the shooting of a woman during unrest on Saturday.

items.title: Trump authorizes national guard deployment to Chicago, White House says, as border patrol there shoots woman
items.standfirst: Illinois governor JB Pritzker says administration is escalating ‘aggression against Illinois citizens and residents’Donald Trump has moved to deploy the national guard in another city by authorizing 300 troops to protect federal officers and assets in Chicago, where the government said border patrol agents shot and injured a woman while firing at someone who tried to run them over.White House spokesperson Abigail Jackson confirmed that the president had authorized using Illinois national guard members, citing what she called “ongoing violent riots and lawlessness” that local leaders have not quelled. Continue reading...
items.content: Illinois governor JB Pritzker says administration is escalating ‘aggression against Illinois citizens and residents’Donald Trump has moved to deploy the national guard in another city by authorizing 300 troops to protect federal officers and assets in Chicago, where the government said border patrol agents shot and injured a woman while firing at someone who tried to run them over.White House spokesperson Abigail Jackson confirmed that the president had authorized using Illinois national guard members, citing what she called “ongoing violent riots and lawlessness” that local leaders have not quelled. Continue reading...

items.title: Oregon judge temporarily blocks deployment of the National Guard to Portland
items.standfirst: U.S. District Judge Karin Immergut, a Trump appointee, issued the temporary restraining order, which is set to expire on Oct. 18, according to court records.
items.content: U.S. District Judge Karin Immergut, a Trump appointee, issued the temporary restraining order, which is set to expire on Oct. 18, according to court records.

items.title: Judge blocks Trump administration from deploying national guard to Portland
items.standfirst: US district judge agrees with Oregon assertion that deployment would likely inflame rather than calm protests in cityA federal judge has blocked the Trump administration from deploying the national guard to Portland, Oregon, according to court documents.Donald Trump had announced on 27 September that he would deploy troops to Portland, “authorizing Full Force, if necessary”, ignoring pleas from local officials and the state’s congressional delegation, who suggested that the president was misinformed or lying about the nature and scale of a single, small protest outside one federal immigration enforcement office. Continue reading...
items.content: US district judge agrees with Oregon assertion that deployment would likely inflame rather than calm protests in cityA federal judge has blocked the Trump administration from deploying the national guard to Portland, Oregon, according to court documents.Donald Trump had announced on 27 September that he would deploy troops to Portland, “authorizing Full Force, if necessary”, ignoring pleas from local officials and the state’s congressional delegation, who suggested that the president was misinformed or lying about the nature and scale of a single, small protest outside one federal immigration enforcement office. Continue reading...

items.title: Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump's National Guard deployment to Portland
items.standfirst: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Portland, Ore., which the president had ordered over the objections of local leaders.
items.content: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Portland, Ore., which the president had ordered over the objections of local leaders.(Image credit: Jenny Kane)

items.content: Trump deploys 300 National Guard troops to Chicago amid protests and criticism from local leaders.

items.title: Russia launches deadly missile and drone attack on Ukraine - as Poland forced to scramble jets

items.content: At least five people have been killed in a massive Russian missile and drone attack on Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said.

items.title: At least five killed in large-scale overnight Russian strikes on Ukraine, Poland scrambles jets
items.standfirst: At lease five civilians were killed after Russian launched a large-scale night-time attack in Ukraine that officials there said targeted civilian infrastructure. NATO member Poland said it scrambled aircraft early on Sunday to ensure its air safety after Russian missiles and drones rained down on the Lviv region near the Polish border.
items.content: At lease five civilians were killed after Russian launched a large-scale night-time attack in Ukraine that officials there said targeted civilian infrastructure. NATO member Poland said it scrambled aircraft early on Sunday to ensure its air safety after Russian missiles and drones rained down on the Lviv region near the Polish border.

items.content: However, his ANO party falls short of an overall majority in preliminary results.

items.title: "Czech Trump" Andrej Babis Wins Election, Returns As Prime Minister In Latest European Populist Revolt
items.standfirst: "Czech Trump" Andrej Babis Wins Election, Returns As Prime Minister In Latest European Populist Revolt Billionaire Andrej Babis's ANO party won the Czech Republic's general parliamentary election on Saturday, and is set to return as prime minister to the central European country, raising the…

items.title: Andrej Babis leads vote count in Czech parliamentary election
items.standfirst: Billionaire Andrej Babis's ANO party cruised to victory in the Czech Republic's parliamentary election on Saturday, raising the prospect of a government that would boost Europe's populist, anti-immigration camp and reduce support for Ukraine. "It is one of the greatest results ever for any party in the history of the modern Czech Republic", said Ian Willoughby, FRANCE 24 correspondent in Prague.
items.content: Billionaire Andrej Babis's ANO party cruised to victory in the Czech Republic's parliamentary election on Saturday, raising the prospect of a government that would boost Europe's populist, anti-immigration camp and reduce support for Ukraine. "It is one of the greatest results ever for any party in the history of the modern Czech Republic", said Ian Willoughby, FRANCE 24 correspondent in Prague.

items.title: Populist billionaire Andrej Babiš wins Czech parliamentary election
items.standfirst: With Babiš’s victory the Czech Republic looks set to join Hungary and Slovakia in refusing support for UkraineThe populist billionaire Andrej Babiš has won the Czech Republic parliamentary elections, preliminary results show, but fallen short of the overall majority.This win marks a political comeback for Babiš, who was prime minister from 2017 to 2021. He is expected to put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and towards Hungary and Slovakia, who have taken a pro-Russian path. Continue reading...
items.content: With Babiš’s victory the Czech Republic looks set to join Hungary and Slovakia in refusing support for UkraineThe populist billionaire Andrej Babiš has won the Czech Republic parliamentary elections, preliminary results show, but fallen short of the overall majority.This win marks a political comeback for Babiš, who was prime minister from 2017 to 2021. He is expected to put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and towards Hungary and Slovakia, who have taken a pro-Russian path. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Trumpist' billionaire Andrej Babis wins Czech parliamentary election
items.standfirst: Populist, billionaire and self-proclaimed "Trumpist" Andrej Babis won the Czech parliamentary election Saturday in a political comeback that put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and towards Hungary and Slovakia, which have taken a pro-Russian path.
items.content: Populist, billionaire and self-proclaimed "Trumpist" Andrej Babis won the Czech parliamentary election Saturday in a political comeback that put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and towards Hungary and Slovakia, which have taken a pro-Russian path.

items.title: Billionaire Babis's party on track to win Czech election
items.standfirst: Billionaire Andrej Babis's ANO party was on track to win the Czech Republic's parliamentary election on Saturday (October 4). FRANCE 24's Ian Willoughby tells us more.

Babis's party fell short of an overall majority in preliminary results.

clusters.title: Who is Japan's 'Iron Lady' Sanae Takaichi?
clusters.neutral_headline: Japan Poised to Get First Female Prime Minister

items.title: Who is Japan's 'Iron Lady' Sanae Takaichi?
items.standfirst: The conservative politician, who sees Margaret Thatcher as an inspiration, is set to be Japan's first female prime minister.
items.content: The conservative politician, who sees Margaret Thatcher as an inspiration, is set to be Japan's first female prime minister.

items.title: Japan set for first female prime minister
items.standfirst: Japan could be about to have its first female prime minister, as a woman is elected leader of the governing party.
items.content: Japan could be about to have its first female prime minister, as a woman is elected leader of the governing party.

items.title: Japan poised to get first female PM after Sanae Takaichi wins ruling party leadership
items.standfirst: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...
items.content: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...

items.title: Sanae Takaichi set to become Japan's first female prime minister
items.standfirst: Takaichi is a long-time admirer of Margaret Thatcher, but many female voters do not see her as an advocate for progress.
items.content: Takaichi is a long-time admirer of Margaret Thatcher, but many female voters do not see her as an advocate for progress.

items.title: Japan is poised for its first-ever female prime minister
items.standfirst: Japan’s governing party elected Sanae Takaichi as its new leader on Saturday, setting her up to become the U.S. ally’s first female prime minister.
items.content: Japan’s governing party elected Sanae Takaichi as its new leader on Saturday, setting her up to become the U.S. ally’s first female prime minister.

ai_summary: Sanae Takaichi is set to become Japan's first female prime minister.
Takaichi was elected leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party.
She is a long-time admirer of Margaret Thatcher.
Takaichi beat her more moderate rival in a runoff election.
Her victory should lead to her being installed as the country's new leader.

clusters.title: Syria: In Raqqa, fear of new episode of violence looms
clusters.neutral_headline: Syria Holds First Parliamentary Elections Since Assad's Ouster

items.title: Syria: In Raqqa, fear of new episode of violence looms
items.standfirst: Syrian electors will select members of its first post-Assad parliament on Sunday (October 5) in a process criticised, with a third of the members appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. The process is widely expected to consolidate the power of Sharaa and raise more questions about how to unite the country after 13 years of civil war. According to the interim government in Damascus, northeastern Syria has been largely excluded from the electoral process for security reasons. Negotiations are supposed to lead to the integration of this Kurdish-dominated region into the rest of Syria, but in the absence of significant progress, the standoff continues. In Raqqa, Kurdish authorities prepare for any eventuality.
items.content: Syrian electors will select members of its first post-Assad parliament on Sunday (October 5) in a process criticised, with a third of the members appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. The process is widely expected to consolidate the power of Sharaa and raise more questions about how to unite the country after 13 years of civil war. According to the interim government in Damascus, northeastern Syria has been largely excluded from the electoral process for security reasons. Negotiations are supposed to lead to the integration of this Kurdish-dominated region into the rest of Syria, but in the absence of significant progress, the standoff continues. In Raqqa, Kurdish authorities prepare for any eventuality.

items.title: What to expect as Syria holds first parliamentary elections since Assad's ouster
items.standfirst: Syria is holding parliamentary elections on Sunday for the first time since the fall of the country's longtime autocratic leader, Bashar Assad, who was unseated in a rebel offensive in December.
items.content: Syria is holding parliamentary elections on Sunday for the first time since the fall of the country's longtime autocratic leader, Bashar Assad, who was unseated in a rebel offensive in December.(Image credit: Omar Sanadiki)

items.title: Syrian electors vote in indirect polls for first post-Assad parliament
items.standfirst: Two-thirds of Syria's new parliament will be chosen by electoral colleges, with the rest appointed by interim president.
items.content: Two-thirds of Syria's new parliament will be chosen by electoral colleges, with the rest appointed by interim president.

items.title: Syria holds first parliamentary elections since Assad's ouster in contested process
items.standfirst: Syrians head to the polls on Sunday to vote for the new lawmakers of its first post-Assad parliament in a process criticised as undemocratic, with a third of MPs appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. According to the organising committee, more than 1,500 candidates – just 14 percent of them women – are running for the assembly, which will have a renewable 30-month mandate.
items.content: Syrians head to the polls on Sunday to vote for the new lawmakers of its first post-Assad parliament in a process criticised as undemocratic, with a third of MPs appointed by interim leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. According to the organising committee, more than 1,500 candidates – just 14 percent of them women – are running for the assembly, which will have a renewable 30-month mandate.

ai_summary: Syria held parliamentary elections on Sunday.
The elections are the first since Bashar Assad's ouster.
Two-thirds of the parliament will be chosen by electoral colleges.
The process is criticized as undemocratic.
Northeastern Syria was largely excluded from the process.

clusters.title: Ukraine says Russia intensifying railway strikes to isolate frontline communities
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia Intensifies Railway Strikes in Ukraine

items.title: Ukraine says Russia intensifying railway strikes to isolate frontline communities
items.standfirst: The head of Ukraine's railways said Saturday (October 4) that Russia was intensifying a campaign of air strikes on the network in an attempt to isolate frontline communities ahead of winter. Russia launched drones at two passenger trains in Ukraine's northeastern Sumy region, killing one person and wounding dozens, according to Ukrainian officials.
items.content: The head of Ukraine's railways said Saturday (October 4) that Russia was intensifying a campaign of air strikes on the network in an attempt to isolate frontline communities ahead of winter. Russia launched drones at two passenger trains in Ukraine's northeastern Sumy region, killing one person and wounding dozens, according to Ukrainian officials.

items.title: Russian strike hits train station in Ukraine, killing at least one
items.standfirst: Russian drones struck trains at a station in Ukraine's northern Sumy region, killing one person and injuring at least 30 others, officials said on Saturday (October 4), with Ukraine's foreign minister accusing Moscow of deliberately hitting passenger trains.
items.content: Russian drones struck trains at a station in Ukraine's northern Sumy region, killing one person and injuring at least 30 others, officials said on Saturday (October 4), with Ukraine's foreign minister accusing Moscow of deliberately hitting passenger trains.

items.title: At least 30 injured in Russian strike on railway station, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Preliminary reports indicate that train staff and passengers were at the site of the strike, he says.
items.content: Preliminary reports indicate that train staff and passengers were at the site of the strike, he says.

items.title: One dead and several injured after Russian drone strike on Ukrainian railway station
items.standfirst: At least one person has died, and several others injured, in a Russian drone strike on a Ukrainian railway station, the country's state emergency services has said.
items.content: At least one person has died, and several others injured, in a Russian drone strike on a Ukrainian railway station, the country's state emergency services has said.

ai_summary: Russia is intensifying air strikes on Ukraine's railway network.
The strikes aim to isolate frontline communities.
Russian drones struck trains in the Sumy region.
One person was killed, and dozens were injured in the strike.
Ukraine's foreign minister accused Moscow of targeting trains.

items.standfirst: Move follows arrest of almost 500 people at latest pro-Palestinian demonstration in London on SaturdayMinisters are to give police new powers to target repeated protests, aimed particularly at cracking down on demonstrations connected to Gaza, the Home Office has said.The announcement, made the morning after almost 500 people were arrested in London for expressing support for Palestine Action, a proscribed organisation, could allow police to order regular protests to take place at a different site. clusters.title: ICE wants to build a 24/7 social media surveillance team
clusters.neutral_headline: ICE plans social media surveillance team

items.title: ICE wants to build a 24/7 social media surveillance team
items.standfirst: ICE plans to hire contractors to scan platforms to target people for deportation.
items.content: United States immigration authorities are moving to dramatically expand their social media surveillance, with plans to hire nearly 30 contractors to sift through posts, photos, and messages—raw material to be transformed into intelligence for deportation raids and arrests. Federal contracting records reviewed by WIRED show that the agency is seeking private vendors to run a multiyear surveillance program out of two of its little-known targeting centers. The program envisions stationing nearly 30 private analysts at Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) facilities in Vermont and Southern California. Their job: Scour Facebook, TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and other platforms, converting posts and profiles into fresh leads for enforcement raids. The initiative is still at the request-for-information stage, a step agencies use to gauge interest from contractors before an official bidding process. But draft planning documents show the scheme is ambitious: ICE wants a contractor capable of staffing the centers around the clock, constantly processing cases on tight deadlines, and supplying the agency with the latest and greatest subscription-based surveillance software.Read full article Comments

items.title: ICE Wants to Build Out a 24/7 Social Media Surveillance Team

ai_summary: ICE wants to build a 24/7 social media surveillance team.
